titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Miscellaneous political campaign material, 1956-1989
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 27886
titlepage.author: Trenton Hizer

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Miscellaneous political campaign material, 1956-1989. Accession 27886, Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous political campaign material, 1956-1989, contains ads, brochures, campaign pins, correspondence, flyers, posters, sample ballots, and other material concerning elections for president; U.S. Senate and House of Representatives; Virginia State Senate and House of Delegates; Governor, Lieutenant Governor, and Attorney General; Richmond, Virginia, city council; and Commonwealth's Attorney. Contains sound recordings of campaign songs for Richard Nixon's 1972 presidential reelection and of campaign commercials for Gerald Baliles' 1985 governor's campaign. Collection also includes correspondence and mailings concerning the Republican, Democratic, American, and U.S. Labor Parties, as well as newsletters mailed to consituents by Senators and Congressmen. There is also a organizational chart for Virginia state government, materials on Republican state conventions, and other miscellaneous items.
